text: George Herbert "Bert" Walker III (March 16, 1931 - January 20, 2020) was an American businessman, diplomat and philanthropist. He was the U.S. Ambassador to Hungary from 2003 to 2006. He was born in St. Louis, Missouri. He was the cousin of Presidents George H. W. and George W. Bush. Walker III died on January 20, 2020 under hospice care in Creve Coeur, Missouri of stroke-related problems at the age of 88. ==References== ==Other websites== *U.S. Embassy - Budapest, Hungary: George Herbert Walker III Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Bush family Category:Ambassadors of the United States Category:American philanthropists Category:Businesspeople from St. Louis, Missouri Category:Politicians from St. Louis, Missouri Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: George Herbert Walker III
